message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CL 

The paper deals with automatic vision systems and proposes a learning-based method for object recognition through glimpses. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category. Additionally, the paper mentions that the proposed method's parameters are learned in a data-driven manner, indicating that it may also belong to the machine learning (cs.LG) sub-category. The paper's focus on object recognition and detection also suggests that it may belong to the artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category. The use of handwritten digits as a dataset suggests that the paper may also belong to the neural and evolutionary computing (cs.NE) sub-category. Finally, the paper's mention of variability in appearance and pose of objects suggests that it may also belong to the natural language processing (cs.CL) sub-category, which deals with similar challenges in text recognition.
